subject: Mental Health
title: Workplace Stress Epidemic
description: A quick, practical guide to Workplace Stress Epidemic.

hook.text: 83 percent of US workers report suffering from work-related stress.

buildup.text: Always-on culture, unclear boundaries, and layoff fears create constant pressure.

discovery.text: High-demand, low-control jobs produce the most stress-related illness.

twist.text: Remote work solved commute stress but created new isolation and boundary problems.

climax.text: Japan has a word for death by overwork: karoshi. It kills thousands each year.

punchline.text: Work was meant to sustain life, not end it.

quiz.question: What does the Japanese term 'karoshi' mean?
